_header: I have great wonder by this light
Subjects: dream poems; chess, game of; elegies; envoys
_description: Chaucer, The Book of the Duchesse — 1334 lines in couplets

Bod638.First Lines:
I haue grete wondir be this lighthow that I leue for day ne
                    nyght…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…As I kan best & that AnoneThis was my sweuyn now it ys
                    done
Bod638.Attributed Title:
The boke of the Duchesse (f. 110v and RT); Explicit The
                    Boke of the Duchesse (f. 141)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.
Bod638.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Odd Texts of the Minor Poems.
             2 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 23, 60. London: Trübner, 1868, 1880; repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

BodFair16.First Lines:
I Have grete wonder be this lyghteHow that I lyve for day ne
                    nyght…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…As I kan best and that anoonThis was my sweuene now hit ys
                    doon
BodFair16.Attributed Title:
The booke of the Duchesse (f. 130) …made by Geffrey Chawcyer at
                    þe request of þe duck of lancastar pitously complaynynge the deathe of
                    þe sayd dutchesse blanche (added by John Stow, 16th century, f.
                    130); Explicit the boke of the duchesse (f. 147v)

BodTan346.First Lines:
I haue gret wondir be þis liȝtehou þat I lyve for
                    day ne nyȝt…
BodTan346.Last Lines:
…[ ] best [ ]at a nonThe [ ] my sweuyn now hit is
                    don
